Praveen AH wrote:
> Hi All, I am praveen doing Integration Unit Testing Using Junit Testing
> Tool. I am aware of writing test scripts using junit tool. I have a
> doubt Do you write seperate Test Case in a word document for Integration
> Testing ?.If yes can you please send some sample of Test Case wherein
> you write Test Case Description, Test CaseID & Test Result.
> 
> Thanks & regards Praveen

JUnit test cases are always written in Java. A description could be 
provided if you want with Javadoc, as could a test case ID (though usually 
the class name and method name would suffice).

How the result is stored is up to the particular test runner you use. If, 
for example, you use the Ant <junit> task, you can store the test results 
as XML, which can then be converted to HTML, via the Ant <junitreport> task.

Examples of how to write test cases can be found in the JUnit 
documentation. Information on the Ant tasks can be found, unsurprisingly, 
in the Ant documentation.
